Outcome:
By the 30th June 2016
psychosocial support and essential information will be provided to at least 1500 refugees and migrants to improve their safety and security in Serbia
Indicator (e.g. "# of liters of water de: # of persons to which psychosocial support and infromation is provided
Revised Target: # of persons to which psychosocial support and infromation is provided
Additional Comments:
3 Outreach teams, composed by 6 people in South and 5 in the North and 4 in Belgrade (including protection officer, cultural mediators and translators) will provide refugees and migrants, with critical information including asylum seekers' rights, services and support available to refugees. Outreach temas will operate 16 hours per day (2 shifts in each location ), 5 day per week. 
Mobile teams will also monitor the border to assess numbers of irregular arrivals and monitor the behavior of authorities, reception and treatment of migrants, access to asylum procedure and care provision to asylum claimants. 
Outreach tems will make around 50 new contact per day, per 5 deys per week, per 6 weeks

Outcome:
By the 30th June 2016 
referral and case management will be provided to at least 150 refugees and migrants in Serbia
Indicator (e.g. "# of liters of water de: # of completed assessments of refugee support needs
Revised Target: # of completed assessments of refugee support needs
Additional Comments: While mainstreaming GBV, anti-trafficking and other protection massages, outreach team will also provide psychosocial support, make referrals to competent institutions and conduct case management

Outcome:
By the 15th May 2016 
a specifc safe shelters for male and female survivors of trafficking, abuse and trauma will be established in Belgrade
Indicator (e.g. "# of liters of water de: # of men and women who are referred to the shelther
Revised Target: # of men and women who are referred to the shelther
Additional Comments: 2 new shelters, one for men and one for women will be established in Belgrade. The activity will complement the existing shelter capacities managed by Atina in Belgrade and allow for separate women and men’s shelters

Outcome:
By the 30th June 2016
at least 18 workshops will be held for refugees and migrants to build skills and knowlegde and increase personal resilience
Indicator (e.g. "# of liters of water de: # of workshop conducted
Additional Comments: Atina’s mobile team will organize empowerment and creative workshops and programmes for women and girls, 3 times per week in the temporary centres for refugees (language, culture, handcraft making). The aims of the craft making workshops will be to empower women and girls and to sensitize the local communities by presenting with the workshops final products. 10 to 15 migrant women and girls will be present on every workshop.

Outcome:
By the 30th June 2016
advocacy materials will be produced that will sensitize local population, public rapresentatives and international audience about condition of the migrants, violation of Human rights, and give voice to the migrants
Indicator (e.g. "# of liters of water de: # of advocacy materials produced
Additional Comments: Activity aims at production of 2 advocacy materials (multimedia content) that will sensitize local population, public rapresentatives and international audience about condition of the migrants, violation of Human rights, and give voice to the migrants

Outcome:
By the 30th June 2016 
protection outreach activities, including legal assistance and psychosocial support, will benefit at least 400 refugees and migrants in Macedonia
Indicator (e.g. "# of liters of water de: # of people provided with legal assistance and psychosocial support
Revised Target: # of people provided with legal assistance and psychosocial support
Additional Comments: Outreach teams, including lawyers, social workers, cultural mediators and translators will provide refugees and migrants with critical information including on rights as asylum seekers, options for claiming asylum, legal representation and services and support available to refugees. They will also provide psychosocial support, make referrals to competent institutions and conduct case management. This activities will mostly take place in Tabanovce RC and is a continuation of outreach activities conducted under the first DFID project and if necessary on other location where refugees and migrants are residing. The activity will provide repeat support to refugees and migrants residing at the Tabanovce PC. Over the course of 1.5 months it is assumed that at least half of the total population (800) in Tabanovce will benefit from either legal assistance or psychosocial support.

Outcome:
By the 15th May 2016 
regular and ongoing monitoring of the Greek-Macedonian and Serbian-Macedonian borders will be conducted to record refugee push backs and irregular migration flows
Indicator (e.g. "# of liters of water de: # of border monitoring reports completed
Additional Comments: Mobile teams will monitor the border to assess numbers of irregular arrivals and monitor the behaviour of authorities, reception and treatment of migrants, access to asylum procedure and care provision to asylum claimants. This activity combines the 25 monitoring visits conducted to the 25 villages along the Macedonian and Greek border. Each monitoring visit conducted will cover 3-4 villages at a time, covering in total 25 different villages. Mobile teams will also provide protection outreach and referal support to refugees and migrants contact through border monitoring activities- The number of migrants who will benefit from a safer environment created through these monitoring activities is an estimation calculated according to local existing statistics on irregula cross-border migration.

Outcome:
By the 30th June 2016 
at least 20 community sensitisation meetings will be conducted in villages along the Macedonian Greek border to improve understanding of refugee issues
Indicator (e.g. "# of liters of water de: # of community sensitisation meetings conducted
Additional Comments:
MYLA will develop and conduct a sensitisation and awareness raising campaign for the local population of the “most affected areas” in order to inform them about refugees, migration and existing services for refugees. 
The activiti is aimed to reduce stigma of refugees and support monitoring and information sharing and to make local population a partner

Outcome:
By the 31st May 2016 
cross border referal processes and procedures have been agreed and established between MYLA and ATINA
Indicator (e.g. "# of liters of water de: # of established referral processes between MYLA and ATINA
Revised Target: # of established referral processes between MYLA and ATINA
Additional Comments: Building on activities already completed in the first DFID project Oxfam will support the further development of a system for information sharing and referral between Serbia and Macedonia, including the establishment of processes and procedures for referring specific refugee/migrant cases between the two countries
